summary: The document is a detailed report from the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) concerning an interview with Sergeant Warren Roberts of the New Orleans Police Department. It details an incident on August 9, 1963, involving Lee Harvey Oswald and three Cubans, where Oswald was distributing communist literature on Canal Street, leading to an altercation and their arrest. The report includes interviews with Oswald and the Cubans, revealing their backgrounds, affiliations, and the day's events. Oswald admitted to being a member of the Fair Play for Cuba Committee (FPFCC) but denied its communist front status. The Cubans, associated with the Cuban Student Directorate, confronted Oswald over his activities.
key_findings: Lee Harvey Oswald was distributing communist literature in New Orleans in August 1963, leading to an altercation with Cuban exiles.
Oswald claimed membership in the Fair Play for Cuba Committee (FPFCC) but denied any communist affiliation of the group.
The incident provides insight into Oswald's political activities and associations prior to the JFK assassination.
The document includes detailed personal information about Oswald and the Cubans involved in the altercation.
The report suggests Oswald was uninformed about the FPFCC's ultimate goals, indicating he might have been used by the organization.
